text: Ordered 3 items for size and preference, kept one and returned the others the same day having simply tried each on in my very clean and tidy bedroom, using the same packaging they were sent in as had kept everything neatly together knowing I would only be retraining one outfit. The quality of the material wasn’t great, but I expected that for the price (the sale price is a fair reflection of value, I’d definitely say full price is absolutely not) and was happy to keep one. However, following return as per the company policy, I received an email stating that no refund would be issued due to stains and smell on the garments, and alleged photos attached to document the concerns. Actually, no photos were attached and the links were empty. Having immediately contacted the company to challenge the decision and ask for sight of the alleged stains, I had a second email response stating that there was ‘dust’ on the items making them unsaleable and in contravention of the returns policy. Again, no images attached and when I replied querying the difference in alleged faults and the lack of visual proof being provided, I was offered 50% of the costs reimbursed. As this was only about £20 and frankly I had neither the time nor energy to keep emailing and pushing it, I accepted the refund and thought I’d just treat this as a lesson learnt not to shop with Rotita again. However, the money was then credited to my account for use on future purchases, rather than refunded to my payment method. So, I had to write yet more emails, attaching the proof of the previous offer of a reimbursement and pointing out that based on my experience I wouldn’t ever shop with them again so credit was no use at all. After several weeks and emails, I finally got the refund issued and a valuable lesson learnt. I would neither trust nor recommend this company to anyone - the advertised returns policy is clearly not followed and a level of dishonesty applied in seeking not to refund returned items

title: BEWARE— THIS IS NOT A LEGITIMATE WEBSITE
text: BEWARE— THIS IS NOT A LEGITIMATE BUSINESS!!!Like so many other “scam” e-commerce websites operating from China, India and Hong Kong, Rotita is not a clothing retailer with a warehouse full of the clothing they display on their ads, waiting to fulfill your order. They build rudimentary websites (written in poor English) with the goal of attracting people to their low prices. Notice how they cut off the faces of all the models in their photos of their supposed merchandise? That is because they steal the images of attractive garments from other retail websites, and the photos are more difficult to trace on the internet if there is no face. So they crop them.These scammer websites have one simple goal: They want your credit card number. Then, after they have taken your money, they will either months later send you something that doesn’t even resemble the garment or accessory you thought you were buying... or, in most cases, you won’t receive anything at all and you will NEVER  get your money back. You’ve been scammed.ALSO, be aware that these scammers know these review sites like trustpilot exist, and they spend a HUGE amount of time writing fake 5 star reviews, talking about how great the products are and how fast they received their orders and how outstanding the customer service is. You can tell these glowing fake reviews are written by people who don’t speak English and they all say the same thing. All lies. All fraud.People need to research the companies they buy from online because nothing is being done to stop these websites. They are hosted overseas and not subject to USA fraud laws. Do not order from this website.

text: I purchased a few tops from Rotita a few months ago and had no problems with them, placing a small order to check on the validity of the site.  I then placed another, larger, order on March 31st through PayPal.  It has not been received. I looked up their contact number: 1-909-281-0551, which was answered, and then disconnected - four times. I have gone to their web site and tried to enquire as to the delay - it will not accept the order number that was indicated on their receipt. This company advertises on AOL - which is how I found them. I then heard back from Rotita today, caller ID from the number above, listed Big Bear City, CA. At first they claimed that the money was never received and PayPal had not sent it. I pointed out that PayPal has a record of the order for $145.00. The man then confirmed this, admitting that Rotita had received the money and that his wrong information was a "server issue." He then stated that, "The item you ordered has been discontinued, so we will refund your money." I pointed out that I had ordered nearly half a dozen items, asking if all were discontinued - when they were currently still selling them on their site - listed as available in all sizes and which is advertised on AOL when I check my e-mail. He again stated that they have a, "server issue," that is being resolved, and refused to acknowledge the other items. Instead, he kept stating that, "The item is discontinued." I then asked about other items, asking about a seventh potential item I might like to order. "Discontinued Mam." (Of course, I hadn't even indicated which item.) I asked that he refund the amount. He asked that I go online with him on the phone, taking me to a 'remote' site, instructing me to press the download button which would refund the money to me.  I pointed out that pressing the 'download' button would, according to the information he failed to disclose to me - yet was listed on the site he had sent me to, would give him full access, and control of, my computer.  I declined his instruction and he stated that, "If you don't give me full remote control of your computer, then we will refuse to refund your money." After denying him access, I told him that I am reporting this - which I will definitely do. After the call ended (roughly 5-10 seconds later), I received another call, from 855-325-3237. The message was that the IRS was coming after me - a known scam. Are these linked? I then found this site, and wish I had found it earlier.  My sympathies go to those who have reported here about allowing access to their computer and the outcomes they endured.  However, it was useful because I found on this site the other number: 509-588-7320.  A man answered.  I asked for Alan (mentioned in review).  He stated that Alan was not there, identifying himself as John.  He confirmed that he represented Rotita and asked what I wanted, so I told him what happened and that I wanted my money back, or the goods that I ordered.  I mentioned that I found his number on this review site, and that the reviewer had expressed success to receive a refund.  He hung up on me.  I tried the other number mentioned in these reviews: 509-207-4166.  Nobody answers.  Area code 509 is Spokane, Washington.  I called the police there, but their lines are only answered M-F 8:30-4.  I will try as per those times.  Haiti also has a 509 code.  However, when you check Rotita's site, they have an address of Shanghai, China.  As I said, when I placed a small order, it came, and I really have no complaints with the first order.  However, the second order reveals what certainly appears to be a possible scam.  Also, I note other comments about the 5-star reviews being false.  I totally agree, and it changes the overall ratings.  However, take a look - the bulk of the positive reviews are in clusters and super short.  For those who have learned to check review sites before ordering, please also check out the site and reviews of Modlily, and Lili Gal.  See anything familiar?

This top showed 55 (4-5) star reviews on THEIR site in the area that the top is showing the picture. It is crucial to know this because when I tried to submit a review on their site, THEY DON'T LET IT POST if less than 4 stars, therefore hiding what people are going through with orders from this company! This shirt showed up and at first I was like what the h---? Why is it so faded as if washed 200 times already, nothing like the vivid wine colored stripes in the picture. Turns out, it was sewn inside out!!! How could this go unnoticed, it was so obvious. My daughter in law put it on inside out to see if she could make it work, seams are to large and noticeable as well as the tags. Besides, why should she have to do that for something so obviously wrong! It doesn't get any lower than a company deciding to send it anyway. It was a gift, shame on you!!! Never again...returning it and letting everyone know about this company!

THE ITEM HAS NOT BEEN SHIPPED YET as I have told them now FOUR more times.  In the meantime, the bathing suits that I have received would not fit an actual human being.  I don't know what kind of mannequin they use, but it can't possibly be human shaped.  The sides of the too small cup (I wear a DDD) stick out on the sides.  I would expect this if the cup was too big, it is actually a bit small.  The halter tops just have a loose elastic around the back that fits very low on the back and does not actually keep the front of the suit from showing your breast to anyone standing next to you.  So to actually wear these suits in public I will have to alter all of them.  And despite ordering the same size for all of them (which I based on their measurement chart, not the product size) they all fit differently.  The customer service SUCKS.  The product SUCKS.

title: ROTITA IS A SCAM!  Beware ROTITA Sells Defective Merchandise
text: I do a lot of my clothes shopping online but this was the first time I dealt with Rotita. I had gotten a catalog from Rotita and a few items looks decent and so I ordered 2 just to try it out. A few minutes after I had placed the order I got an email saying that my order should arrive in about 3 to 5 weeks. Curious about why it would take so long, I then saw that the merchandise was coming from China.  No where on Rotita's website does it say that they located in China.  Had I known that I never would have made this purchase.  And why? Because if either item didn't fit and I wanted to return them, I knew that the shipping cost to China would be prohibitive.  Anyway after 8 weeks I received the items and both items were damaged.  One had two huge holes in it and the other was a top that was pieced together and where the pieces were sewn together the fabric was all bunched up.  Also, both tops had unfinished hems - bottoms and sleeves - as if no one bothered to hem them.  I communicated all this to Rotita (through their website) and had to take pictures to prove the damages. Rotita's initial response was that they would give me $14.95 and I could keep the items.  I didn't want to keep these tops.  I would NEVER wear them!  The 2 items cost me $59.00, and so basically what Rotita was doing was reducing my loss by 25%.  I didn't think it was right that I should  pay anything for damaged merchandise.  When I communicated this with Rotita they came back with another offer.  I could keep the tops and they would refund me $47.20.  Now they were offering me 80% off.  And that would have been great if only I was able to wear these tops. When I rejected their second offer and told them that I wanted a FULL REFUND along with a free shipping label, they then came and wrote that they would issue a full refund after I returned the merchandise to them and they gave me an address in Shanghai, China.  They refused to give me a free shipping label. I then got a quote from UPS that the shipping would be $125.  Fed Ex was more. Frustrated, I contacted PayPal and in the end all PayPal did was communicate with the seller.  PayPal sent me similar emails - first an offer of $30 off, then when I rejected that offer, PayPal wrote to me that I could return both items to Shanghai and then they will refund the $59.00.  When I finally told Rotita that I would accept the $47.20, (without having to return the items) they said fine and that they would credit my account. That was 3 months ago.  Now they don't even bother responding to my messages.  So the moral of the story - DON"T BUY ANYTHING FROM Rotita, - ROTITA.com

Suddenly they replied with an offer (still no apologies): I could sell my items online (ebay!) and get a 'good price' out of it plus a 15% discount on my next purchase with Rotita (Noooo, please, never again!!!) or i could return the whole disastrous package with postage at my own expense (this is part of their policy and is visible on their page). title: Don't buy from Rotita
text: On the advice of her Mum, I bought my great-niece a dress from Rotita for Christmas. My niece also bought 2 dresses from them for her daughter's Christmas present.There was no way of knowing (unless I'd trawled through the internet - which, of course, I didn't! What an idiot, eh?) that the dress came from Shanghai in China; there was no way of finding that fact out on their website; it's not mentioned! Only when the dress arrived did it become apparent that the supplier was in China due to the postage label including the supplier's address, etc. An alarm bell rang but, the dress looked so good, I put it to the back of my mind.Christmas Day came and the dress I'd bought from Rotita was obviously too small to be worn, even though the size had been checked using Rotita's guidelines.After much prissying about with Rotita's online "Ticket" system (emailing) for notifying them of a required refund or returning the dress, they agreed that, as postage to return the dress would cost around £35 (slightly more than the dress cost), I should keep the dress and they would refund me 20% of the cost; not brilliant, but it was all I could get out of them.I was going to order another dress from Rotita for my great-niece when I received a 'demand' letter from TNT (the firm who delivered the dress to my address) for an amount greater than the cost of the dress; it appears Customs and Excise want their 'cut' because Rotita, presumably, don't pay the required tax for the items they send to this country. The total amount that TNT are requesting is 125% of the cost of the dress. So, we have a dress which is too small to be worn, I've paid out for the full original cost (as I won't be using the refund now) PLUS the tax imposed for postage . . . the total cost is 225% of the cost stated on the Rotita website!Unbelievable! . . . But TRUE . . . I must say that the two dresses my niece bought from Rotita fit my great-niece well but, as they were ordered later than my order, my niece's 'tax' letter hasn't turned up yet.If you're thinking of buying anything from Rotita, think twice; in fact, think 3 or 4 times. Multiply the cost shown on the website by, say, 225% and you can then see whether you think the item is worth the hassle (especially if their guidelines result in them sending a dress which doesn't fit!). DON'T BUY FROM ROTITA!!!!!!!!!
